title: Excellent hotel among others
text:
I will briefly write about my experience in this hotel.
Location: Absolutely perfect, No. 1 on Avenue Carnot offers a spectacular view over L'Arc de Triomphe and it is close to everything you would like to do and see in Paris. Actually any avenue that makes L'etoile represent the best location for Paris.
Lobby: Half of it with, including the reception are not spectacular and looks worn-out, the other half with the bar is cosy and nice. But the surprise is on the floors.
Halls and bedrooms: Very graceful and beautiful halls, based on the conception of L'Impresionisme. A Monet is missing on the walls, as I may say. The rooms are amongst the largest I've seen in Paris within the old buildings transformed in hotels. At least mine was a small apartment with a huge room, bathroom and hall with dressing.
The room had everything you'd need: toiletry, coffee and tea maker, biscuits and a good choice of beverages in the minibar (even quite expensive)
The only annoying thing was the room-maid that came at least 3 times a day, walking me up from my short evening nap, every day when I was coming tired from the fair (18.00 hours), mornings or mid-day.
Breakfast at the hotel, I really don't know how it is as I considered way to expensive ( â‚¬ 25) and I have chosen a bakery nearby, having a delicious breakfast for as less as an average 7 euros per person.
Of course the price per room is accordingly to any good hotel in Paris but I totally recomend this hotel with no exception.
